title: Digha - a scenic beach resort city home to 7 k.m. long sunny and breezy beach

Located on the northern tip of the West Bengal state overlooking the Bay of Bengal Digha is a seaside resort city that is most known for the lavish beach resorts, beautiful beaches and the low gentle waves visiting them, numerous tourist resorts, and tranquility that abides in the region. It is one of the premier tourist resorts in the state and sees a continuous influx of visitors yearlong. 

The average elevation of the place is just 6 meters above the sea level. Kolkata, the state's capital and the most developed city in the state as well as north-east India is about 187 k.m. away. Digha is a popular weekend getaway from Kolkata. Two national highways, NH 1 and NH116B connect Kolkata with the tourist resort. It ideally takes a little more than four hours to cover the distance. There are frequent buses running from Kolkata Dharmatala Bus Stand at regular time intervals. Apart from that Kolkata also houses the major commercial airport connecting the region to rest of India. Additionally, private taxis are the more comfortable and convenient modes to access the sea-coast city. Besides,Transportation services to the railway station and Kolkata are also offered by several Digha hotels. One can also access Digha via trains. There is a small railway station a few kilometers away from the city. Although the frequency of trains is small, still they are highly preferred by the tourists. 
Formerly called as Beerkul, the place owes the British for popularizing it as an ideal seaside resort. It were they who saw the tourism potential of the place. The contributions made by John Frank Snaith, an English businessman who lived here are particularly noteworthy. He wrote about the place in many of his writings providing the exposure that the place needed. He also played a major role in convincing Bidhan Chandra Roy, then Chief Minister of West Bengal in the development of the place as a popular beach resort. 

As a tourist destination Digha is perfect for beach lovers and honeymooners. But one will also find a large number of families here. The scenic beauty of the place appeals to the travellers. The long sandy beaches extending up to 7 k.m. are the main tourist spots. The beach called as Old Digha beach often remains crowded by tourists. One will find a couple of shacks and hawkers selling junk jewelry, books, local handicrafts etc. Spending a lazy day at the beach, sipping the coconut water, and basking the sun is a popular activity here. Alongside the beaches there is a never-ending streak of Casuarina, which gives a striking contrast to the place. Watching sunset and sunrise is yet another popular activity amongst the tourists. 
Digha in particular is famous for the large number of hotels, resorts, and lodges. There is a mass of lodging options alongside the beaches, so finding a suitable hotel is quite easy. The cheap hotels in Digha in particular are popular amongst the tourist. Most of the luxury hotels also feature excellent dining options. Plus, they also offer spa and other recreational facilities.
